intro: Meconopsis autumnalis, commonly known as the autumn meconopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant is known for its relatively short growing season. Meconopsis autumnalis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
